intro: Chassalia oxylepis, commonly known as the mountain chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland and rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive appearance. Chassalia oxylepis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
